CONCLUSION: No violation of Art. 8;No violation of Art. 10;No violation of Art. 13
TEXT: CARDINAL . ORG The applicant , Mr. PERSON , is a NORP citizen born in DATE and a carpenter by profession .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE , he started to work as a temporary replacement in a post of museum technician ( vikarierande museitekniker ) at FAC at GPE in the south of GPE . The museum is adjacent to FAC which is a restricted military security zone .

The applicant maintained before the ORG that the intention was that he should work for DATE in this post , while its ordinary holder was on leave . He alleged that on DATE he was told to leave his work pending the outcome of a personnel control which had to be carried out on him in accordance with ORG personal - kontrollkungörelsen CARDINAL:CARDINAL - see paragraphs DATE below ) . According to the applicant , this control had been requested on DATE .

The Government submitted that the applicant was employed only from DATE to CARDINAL DATE , as evidenced by a notice to this effect , issued on DATE by the Director of the ORG . They further contended that in employing Mr. PERSON the Director had committed CARDINAL mistakes . Firstly , it was not in accordance with the procedure prescribed in the LAW and the relevant regulations issued thereunder to employ a person before a personnel control had been undertaken and , secondly , the post had not been properly declared vacant .
CARDINAL . ORG The necessary steps were taken on CARDINAL DATE . The post was opened for application until DATE . Mr. PERSON did not apply .
CARDINAL . ORG It appears that on DATE the Director informed him that the outcome of the personnel control had been unfavourable and that he could therefore not be employed at the ORG .

CARDINAL . ORG Following the advice of the Security Chief of FAC , the applicant wrote to the Commander - in - Chief of the ORG ( chefen för marinen ) requesting to be informed of the reasons why he could not be employed at ORG .
In his reply of DATE , the Commander - in - Chief of the ORG stated , inter alia :

" The ORG possesses several storage rooms and historical objects within the area for the security of which the Chief of FAC ( örlogsbaschefen ) is responsible . According to the information received by the Commander - in - Chief of the ORG , the person holding the post in question must have freedom to circulate within areas subject to special restrictions regarding access . The rules on access to these areas must therefore also be applied to the personnel employed at the ORG .
It is for these reasons that the Chief of the Naval Base requested a personnel control .
The control carried out has provided such grounds for the Commander - in - Chief ’s assessment of you from a security point of view that the decision has been taken not to accept you .

However , if your duties at ORG will not necessitate that you have access to the naval installations at FAC , the Commander - in - Chief sees no reason to oppose your employment . The decision whether or not to employ you is taken in a procedure distinct from the present one . "

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE , the applicant complained to the Government and requested that the assessment of the Commander - in - Chief of the ORG be cancelled and that he be declared acceptable for the temporary employment at ORG , irrespective of the possibility of being reinstated in that employment . He pointed out in particular that he had left a permanent position in GPE , in LOC , on being told that he was accepted for employment at FAC and that a negative outcome of the personnel control could mean social misery , especially considering that he had a wife and child to support . In his original complaint , and also in a letter of DATE , Mr. PERSON further requested that he be given information about the reasons for his not being accepted at FAC .
The Government requested the opinion of the Supreme Commander of ORG ( överbefälhavaren ) , who in turn consulted the Commander - in - Chief of the ORG .
The Commander - in - Chief of the ORG explained in a letter of DATE that he had received the result of the personnel control from the ORG Commander on DATE together with the following proposal :

" Accepted in accordance with the assessment of the [ Commander - in - Chief of the ORG ] , on condition that ORG does not , through access to the ORG ’s premises or through his work , obtain insight into secret activities . "

The Commander - in - Chief of the ORG added that , according to his information , the Director of the ORG required the person employed in the post in question to have free access to , and freedom to circulate in , FAC and that accordingly , on DATE , he had taken the decision not to accept the applicant .
In his reply to the Government , the Supreme Commander of ORG stated , inter alia :

" However , the employment of Mr. PERSON during this time , DATE , did not involve any access to FAC . The Commander - in - Chief of the ORG has said that he does not oppose such employment . The Director of ORG has , however , affirmed the requirement that Mr. PERSON should have access to FAC .

In view of the above and the fact that , if Mr. PERSON was given access to FAC , he would have access to secret installations and information , the Commander - in - Chief of the ORG decided not to accept the applicant .

When dealing with the present case , the Commander - in - Chief of the ORG has entirely followed existing regulations concerning the assessment of personal qualifications from a security point of view .

Like the Commander - in - Chief of the ORG , the ORG Commander of ORG considers that Mr. PERSON may properly be employed by ORG provided that the holder of the appointment does not require access to FAC . "

The opinion of the Supreme Commander of ORG was accompanied by a secret annex , containing the information on Mr. PERSON released by ORG ( rikspolisstyrelsen ) . This annex was never communicated to the applicant and has not been included in the material submitted to the ORG .

CARDINAL . ORG In a letter of CARDINAL DATE , the applicant raised new grievances before the ORG . These concerned the decision of ORG not to exercise its powers under LAW of ORG to communicate to him the information released on him ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . The applicant requested that the Government should , before taking a decision on his request of CARDINAL DATE , give him the right to be apprised of and to comment upon the information thus released by ORG .
On this matter , the ORG sought the opinion of ORG . In its reply of CARDINAL DATE , ORG proposed that the applicant ’s complaints be dismissed . It added :

" The entering of information in the register of ORG is based mainly on a DATE LAW which is secret . Before information is entered , the question of registration is subject to assessment , at several levels , by civil servants under responsibility to verify compliance with the above - mentioned rules in relation to each item of information . In the event of doubt , the question of registration is decided upon by the Chief of ORG .

Information from the register is handed out in accordance with section CARDINAL of ORG after decision by ORG in plenary meeting . CARDINAL of the CARDINAL members of ORG who are appointed amongst parliamentarians should be present when decisions are taken in matters of personnel control . In the case of the applicant , all CARDINAL members were present .

Under LAW of ORG , the person whom the information concerns ought to be given the opportunity to submit observations on the matter if special reasons give cause for this . However , ORG did not see any cause to apply this provision in the case of the applicant as no special reasons were found , and also as the registering had been effected in accordance with the secret Royal Decree and disclosure of the information would have revealed part of the contents of that Decree . "

Mr. PERSON replied to this opinion in a letter of CARDINAL DATE to the Government , in which he argued , inter alia , that the ORG should have communicated to him , at least orally and subject to a duty of confidentiality , the information kept on him .
CARDINAL . ORG By decision of CARDINAL DATE , the ORG rejected the whole of the applicant ’s complaint . In its operative parts , the decision read :

" The question whether or not a person is suitable for certain employment can only be examined by the Government in the context of a complaint about the appointment to a post . PERSON has lodged no appeal with the Government in respect of appointment . His request that the Government should declare him acceptable for the provisional employment concerned can not therefore be examined .

In the present case , there are no such special circumstances as are mentioned in LAW which would give GPE the right to be acquainted with the information about him released by ORG to the ORG Commander of ORG .
The remainder of ORG ’s petition is a request to be given an extract from , or information about the contents of , a police register .
The Government reject [ this ] request ...
The Government do not examine ORG request for a revised assessment of his person and take no measure in regard to any other part of his petition . "
CARDINAL . ORG The applicant maintained before the ORG that he still did not know the content of the secret information recorded on him .

Regarding his personal background , he furnished the following details to the ORG and the ORG . At the relevant time , he had not belonged to any political party DATE . Earlier he had been a member of ORG . He had also been a member of an association publishing a radical review - Fib / Kulturfront . During his military service , in DATE , he had been active in the ORG union and a representative at the ORG union conference in DATE which , according to him , had been infiltrated by the security police . His only criminal conviction stems from his time in military service and consisted of a fine of CARDINAL NORP Crowns for having been late for a military parade . He had also been active in GPE and he had travelled a couple of times in LOC .

The applicant asserted however that , according to unanimous statements by responsible officials , none of the above - mentioned circumstances should have been the cause for the unfavourable outcome of the personnel control .

CARDINAL . ORG According to LAW , section CARDINAL , of ORG ( regeringsformen , which forms the main constituent of LAW and is hereafter referred to as " the LAW " ) , " no entry regarding a citizen in a public register may without his consent be founded exclusively on his political opinion " .

CARDINAL . ORG The legal basis of the register kept by ORG ( " the secret police - register " ) is to be found in ORG , which was enacted by the ORG under their regulatory powers and which was originally published in ORG ( svensk författningssamling , CARDINAL:CARDINAL ) . LAW ( as amended by LAW CARDINAL:CARDINAL ) provides :

" For the special police service responsible for the prevention and detection of offences against national security , etc . , ORG within ORG shall keep a police - register . In this register , ORG may enter information necessary for the special police service .

In the police - register referred to in the first paragraph , no entry is allowed merely for the reason that a person , by belonging to an organisation or by other means , has expressed a political opinion . Further provisions concerning the application of this rule shall be laid down by the Government . "
CARDINAL . ORG In consequence , the following instructions , published on DATE , were given to ORG by the Government :

" In this country , there exist organisations and groups engaging in political activities which involve the use or the possible use of force or threats of compulsion as means to achieve their political aims .

Some organisations have adopted a programme in which it is said that the organisation shall endeavour to change the social system by violence . It can be assumed , however , that a large part of the membership of such organisations will never take part in the realisation of the goals in the programme . The mere fact of being a member of such an organisation does not therefore constitute a reason for the Security Police to make an entry about a person in its register . An entry may be made , however , if a member or a supporter of such an organisation has acted in a way which justifies the suspicion that he may be prepared to participate in activities which endanger national security or which are aimed at , and may contribute towards , overthrowing the democratic system by force or affecting the status of GPE as an independent ORG .

There also exist organisations and groups which may engage in , or may have engaged in , political subversion in GPE or in other GPE , while using force , threats or compulsion as means for such subversion . Information about members or supporters of such organisations or groups shall be entered in the register of ORG .

Further instructions concerning the application of LAW shall be issued by the ORG following proposals from ORG . If , in the special police service , circumstances appear which may call for amendments to the instructions issued by ORG should submit proposals for such amendments . "
CARDINAL . ORG Further instructions , this time secret , were issued by the Government on DATE and again on DATE .

CARDINAL . ORG In addition to the circumstances provided for in ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , information from the secret police - register appears also to be released by ORG in certain cases of public prosecution and in matters relating to applications for NORP citizenship .

CARDINAL . ORG In addition to the above - mentioned provisions regarding the secret police - register , ORG contains provisions as to , inter alia , the posts which are to be security classified , the procedure for handing out information and the use of the information released . The main relevant provisions are summarised below .

CARDINAL . ORG According to LAW , personnel control means the obtaining of information from police registers in respect of persons holding or being considered for appointment to posts of importance for national security .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL ( as amended by LAW ) enumerates certain authorities , including ORG of ORG , entitled to request a personnel control .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL specifies that a personnel control may only be carried out with regard to certain posts of importance for national security . The posts concerned are divided into CARDINAL security classes ( skyddsklasser ) , depending upon whether or not they are of vital importance for national security . The decision to classify a post in Security Class CARDINAL is taken by the Government , whereas the right to classify a post in Security Class CARDINAL is normally delegated to the authority in question .

CARDINAL . ORG According to section DATE , requests for release of information for the purposes of a personnel control are to be made to ORG and the request shall be made only with regard to the person whom it is intended to appoint to the post .
CARDINAL . Sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL deal with what information may be handed out to the appointing authority .

If the post in question falls within Security Class CARDINAL , ORG may , under section CARDINAL , release all information on the person concerned contained in the secret police - register or in any other police register . If the post comes within Security Class CARDINAL , the ORG may , by virtue of section CARDINAL ( as amended by LAW ) , only supply a certain specific kind of information on the person concerned , namely

" CARDINAL . his conviction for , or his being suspected of having committed , crimes mentioned in paragraph CARDINAL of the Act of DATE ( no . CARDINAL ) laying down special provisions on investigation measures in certain criminal cases ( lag med särskilda bestämmelser om tvångsmedel i vissa brottmål ) or mentioned in LAW , paragraphs CARDINAL or DATE , of LAW " - mainly crimes against public peace , national security or the Government - " or his conviction for , or his being suspected of , an attempt , conspiracy or incitement to commit such crimes ;

CARDINAL . his conviction for , or his being suspected of having committed , such other acts as constitute crimes against the security of the ORG , or which are intended and liable to bring about the violent overthrow of the democratic government or to affect the country ’s position as an independent ORG ; or his conviction for , or his being suspected of , an attempt or conspiracy to commit such crimes ;
CARDINAL . his being suspected , on the basis of his activities or otherwise , of being ready to participate in such acts as are mentioned in sub - paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL . "

CARDINAL . ORG LAW provides that , when deciding whether or not to make information from the register available , the ORG shall be composed of the LAW ( rikspolischefen ) , the Head of ORG and those members of ORG who have been appointed by the Government ; there are CARDINAL such lay members - usually Members or former Members of ORG from different political parties , including the Opposition - and CARDINAL of them must be present when the decision is taken .

Information may be released only if all the participating members of ORG agree on the decision . Where CARDINAL or more of the lay members of ORG oppose release of certain information , the National Police Commissioner may refer the matter to the Government for decision if he considers that the information should be made available . Such reference to the Government shall also be made if CARDINAL of the lay members so requests .

CARDINAL . ORG When a request for a personnel control is received by ORG , the practice is the following . ORG draws up a memorandum on the information contained in the relevant registers and presents this orally to ORG , which , after deliberation , decides whether the information should be handed out in whole or in part . In taking this decision , it considers among other things the nature of the post in question , the degree of reliability of the information and how old the entries are . When a file contains only a few entries , this is a factor which may militate against disclosure . There are no written instructions on disclosure apart from the provisions of the Ordinance and ORG .

CARDINAL . ORG At the relevant time , LAW prescribed that before information was released by ORG in cases relating to appointment to posts classified in Security Class CARDINAL , the person concerned should be given an opportunity of presenting his observations in writing or orally , unless there were special reasons to the contrary . In cases of appointment to posts classified in Security Class CARDINAL , the above notification procedure was to be applied only if required on account of special circumstances . However , in no case concerning a Security Class CARDINAL post does the ORG ever seem to have found any special circumstances to be present and , accordingly , such notification was never made - in spite of the fact that various important authorities , including the Chancellor of ORG and ORG , called upon to comment on the legislative proposal which was to become the GPE had recommended the making of at least some form of notification .

This provision was amended as from DATE ( Ordinance CARDINAL ) . At present , before information is released in cases of appointment to posts in all ORG , the person concerned must be given the opportunity of presenting his observations in writing or orally . This rule does not , however , apply if the person would thereby come to know information classified as secret by virtue of any provision in LAW , except for LAW in LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , or if the requesting authority , in cases not concerned with appointment to official posts , has been exempted by the Government from the requirement of informing the person concerned of the personnel control ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
CARDINAL . ORG At the time of the proceedings in Mr. PERSON ’s case , ORG was , under section DATE , prohibited from adding any comments to the information released to the requesting authority .
CARDINAL . ORG Section CARDINAL provided that before an authority initiated a personnel control , it had to inform the person concerned thereof - with one exception not relevant in the present case .

CARDINAL . ORG LAW prescribed that it was the requesting authority that should independently assess the importance of the information released from the police register(s ) , having regard to the nature of the activities connected with the post in question , the authority ’s own knowledge of the person concerned and other circumstances .

CARDINAL . ORG Over DATE , the Minister of ORG has been actively engaged in the supervision of the security police and the personnel control . He has made a number of investigations of varying depth . The investigations made by the Minister of Justice do not result in any reports . However , the Government stated that the deliberations between the Minister and ORG have led to amendments of both the public and the secret instructions .

CARDINAL . ORG The Office of the Chancellor of ORG has a long tradition and is now established in LAW , section CARDINAL , of the LAW . His functions and powers are set out in LAW by the Chancellor of ORG ( lag DATE om justitiekanslerns tillsyn ) and in the Government ’s Instruction to the Chancellor ( förordning DATE med instruktion för justitiekanslern ) .

The duties of the Chancellor of ORG , as laid down by ORG ( riksdag ) , include supervising the public authorities and their employees in order to ensure that their powers are exercised in accordance with the law and the applicable regulations . In this capacity , he often receives and examines complaints from individuals . He also has to act on the ORG ’s behalf in order to safeguard the rights of the ORG and has to assist the ORG with advice and investigations in legal matters .

The appointment as Chancellor of ORG is made by the ORG and continues until retirement age . According to LAW , section CARDINAL , of the LAW , the Chancellor is subordinate to the Government . However , section CARDINAL of the same LAW provides : " No public authority , " - including the Government - " nor the ORG , nor the decision - making body of a municipality may determine how an administrative authority " - including the Chancellor of ORG - " shall make its decision in a particular case concerning the exercise of public authority against a private subject or against a municipality , or concerning the application of law . "

The Chancellor of ORG has the right to attend all deliberations held by courts and administrative authorities , although without expressing his opinion . He is also entitled to have access to all files or other documents kept by the authorities .
All public authorities as well as their employees must provide the Chancellor of ORG with such information and reports as he may request ( see also paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
In his supervisory capacity , he may institute criminal proceedings against public servants or he may report them with a view to disciplinary proceedings .

The Chancellor may , in agreement with ORG , transfer to him cases involving individual complaints , and vice versa . Thus , identical complaints will in practice be considered by either the Chancellor or the ORG , but not by both .
CARDINAL . ORG , being a public authority , and its activities , including personnel control , fall under the Chancellor of ORG ’s supervision .

The Chancellor of ORG visits the ORG and its ORG regularly , generally once a year . In addition , visits take place if special reasons so warrant . A complaint from an individual may constitute such a special reason . His visits are always recorded and TIME are drafted in such a way that they may be made public . If secret material has to be recorded , the secret passages in TIME will not be made public . The Government have submitted a copy of TIME of an inspection visit of DATE , from which it appears that the Chancellor of ORG together with CARDINAL officials of the Chancellery inspected the LOC of ORG and discussed , inter alia , questions concerning personnel control . Nothing emerged from the visit which called for special mention .

The Chancellor of ORG has no power to alter a decision by ORG , nor can he interfere with their decision - making in general , although he is free to make statements about actions that he deems to be contrary to law or inappropriate .

Since opinions expressed by the Chancellor in relation to an inspection of the personnel control procedure are not legally binding , it might perhaps be doubted whether they fall within the sphere where the Chancellor is guaranteed independence by virtue of LAW , section CARDINAL , of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . In view of NORP legal tradition , it is however inconceivable that the Government would endeavour to use their powers under LAW , section CARDINAL , of the LAW so as to give the Chancellor instructions as to , for example , the opinion he should give in a matter concerning the application of ORG , or generally to prohibit him from monitoring the activities of ORG ; no such instructions exist and none has ever been given .

CARDINAL . ORG The functions and powers of ORG , an institution that dates back to DATE , are laid down in particular in LAW , section CARDINAL , of the LAW , and in LAW to the Parliamentary Ombudsmen ( lag CARDINAL med instruktion för justitieombudsmännen ) .
The CARDINAL holders of the office of ORG are elected by ORG . Their main task is to supervise the application , within the public administration , of laws and other regulations .

It is the particular duty of an ORG to ensure that courts of law and administrative authorities observe the provisions of the LAW regarding objectivity and impartiality and that the fundamental rights and freedoms of citizens are not encroached upon in the processes of public administration .

If , while performing his supervisory duties , an ORG should find cause to raise the question of amending legislation or of any other measure the ORG should take , he may present a statement on the subject to the ORG or the Government .
An Ombudsman exercises supervision either on complaint from individuals or by carrying out inspections and other investigations he deems necessary .

The examination of a matter is concluded by a report in which the ORG states his opinion on whether the measure contravenes the law or is inappropriate in any other respect . The ORG may also make pronouncements aimed at promoting uniform and proper application of the law .

The ORG ’s reports are considered to be expressions of his personal opinion . Whether or not his statements will have any practical effects depends on his ability to convince the decision - maker or authority in question . Those concerned often , but by no means always , abide by the ORG ’s opinion ( see PERSON / PERSON , PERSON , GPE DATE , p. CARDINAL ) .

An Ombudsman may institute a criminal prosecution or disciplinary proceedings against an official who has committed an offence by departing from the obligations incumbent upon him in his official duties .

An Ombudsman may be present at the deliberations of a court or an administrative authority and shall have access to the TIME and other documents of any such court or authority . Any court , any administrative authority and any civil servant in central or local government must provide the ORG with such information and reports as he may request . In the performance of his duties , the ORG may request the assistance of any public prosecutor .
CARDINAL . ORG It follows from the foregoing that ORG and its activities come under the supervision of the Parliamentary Ombudsmen .

According to information submitted by the registrar of the Parliamentary Ombudsmen , the procedure in cases of individual complaint is the following . When the complaint is lodged , the ORG responsible contacts the ORG or the requesting authority ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . He will then be furnished with oral opportunity to study the relevant documents and files . This information is not entered on any record kept by the ORG , as that would entail problems as to how to preserve the secret character of the information . The ORG arrives at his opinion on the basis of the inquiry described above and of the results of any other investigations undertaken . His report is always drawn up in writing and made accessible to the public . It does not therefore set out any secret information .

Since DATE there have been CARDINAL individual complaints relating to the personnel control system . CARDINAL were complaints of a general nature by notorious complainants . After having investigated the factual circumstances underlying the other CARDINAL complaints , the ORG closed the file in CARDINAL of them only after having expressed specific criticism in respect of certain issues ( reports of DATE in case DATE and of CARDINAL DATE in case DATE ) . The criticism expressed by the ORG in the report of CARDINAL DATE has , according to a recent judgment of ORG ( no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE ) , led ORG of ORG to change a previous practice regarding the application of section CARDINAL of the Ordinance .

CARDINAL . ORG on ORG consists of CARDINAL Members of ORG nominated on a proportional basis . Since DATE , it has considered the appropriations for the security branch of the police and , DATE , scrutinised the expenses of the security police , its organisation and activities . A great interest has , according to the Government , been shown in matters concerning ORG and its application and in the question of assessing the influence of the lay members of ORG on the activities of the security police . The ORG normally informs itself by holding hearings with spokesmen of ORG and its ORG and by regular visits . Such visits took place in DATE , the DATE and DATE . In DATE , special discussions took place between the ORG and the parliamentarians on ORG . In DATE , the ORG asked for , and received , a special report . In DATE , ORG held a hearing with the National Police Commissioner and the Head of ORG .

According to the Government , the Principal Secretary to ORG has confirmed that the members of ORG , during their visits , have full access to the registers and that they have also examined the register kept at ORG . The members have also discussed various matters concerning the keeping of the register with the officials responsible for making the entries and putting data before ORG when a personnel control is carried out .
CARDINAL . ORG Under LAW ( tryckfrihetsförordningen ) , which is part of LAW , everyone is entitled to have access to a public document unless , within defined areas , such access is limited by law .

At the relevant time , the main provisions concerning these limitations were found in the Act on Restrictions on the Right of Access to Public Documents ( lag om inskränkningar i rätten att utbekomma allmänna handlingar CARDINAL:CARDINAL , " LAW " ) , which was in force until DATE .

Under LAW of LAW ( as amended ) , " details of information entered on such registers as are mentioned in the LAW on ORG ( lag om allmänt kriminalregister CARDINAL:CARDINAL ) or in LAW ( lag om polisregister m.m . CARDINAL:CARDINAL ) may not be handed out in any other cases or manner than those provided for in those Acts " . According to section CARDINAL of LAW ( as amended by LAW , in force until DATE ) :
" Extracts from or information on the contents of police registers shall be given upon request from
CARDINAL . the Chancellor of ORG , the Parliamentary Ombudsmen , ORG , ORG , ORG , county administrative courts , ORG or public prosecutors ;
CARDINAL . other authorities , if and to the extent that the ORG , for certain types of cases or in a specific case , have given the necessary authorisation ;

CARDINAL . an individual , if he needs the extract in order to secure his rights in a foreign country , in order to enter a foreign country or in order to take up residence or domicile or to work there , or in order to have decided questions of employment or contracts related to activities concerned with health - care or with matters of importance from a national security point of view , and the Government by way of special ordinance have authorised that extracts or information be given for such purposes , or , in other cases , if the individual can prove that he depends on obtaining information from the register in order to secure his rights , and the ORG authorise such information to be given to him . "
As of DATE , LAW was replaced by LAW ( sekretesslagen , CARDINAL ) and similar regulations are now to be found in LAW , section CARDINAL , of this Act .
No evidence has been adduced of any special ordinance allowing individuals in the applicant ’s situation to obtain extracts from the police registers .

CARDINAL . ORG A decision by an authority other than the ORG or the Government to refuse access to a document is subject to appeal to the courts ( LAW , section CARDINAL , of the Freedom of the Press Act ) .

In several recent cases decided by ORG , individuals have been refused access to information contained in the secret police - register as they had not obtained or sought the previous authorisation by the Government required by the above - cited section CARDINAL of LAW ( Yearbook of ORG : CARDINAL and Ab CARDINAL and DATE : Ab CARDINAL ) .

This is consistent with the events in the present case , in that the Government declared themselves competent to examine Mr. PERSON ’s request to be acquainted with the information about him released by ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .

However , no appeal - either to the ORG or to the administrative courts - against a decision of the ORG to release information to the requesting authority seems to be available to the individual concerned , since he is not considered to be a party to the release procedure before ORG ( see ORG decision of DATE in case DATE ) .

CARDINAL . ORG Even if a certain document is secret , the Government always have a certain discretionary power to release it , and a person who is a party to judicial or administrative proceedings in which the document is of relevance may still be allowed access to it . The basic provisions in this respect were , until DATE , contained in section CARDINAL of LAW ( as amended by LAW ) , which stated :

" Whenever it is found necessary in order to secure public or individual rights , the Government may , without being subject to the restrictions otherwise laid down in this LAW , provide for the release of documents .

If a document which may not be released to everybody can be presumed to be of importance as evidence in a trial or police investigation in a criminal matter , the court which handles the case or which is competent to decide questions relating to the police investigation may order that the document should be released to it or to the officer in charge of the police investigation . The foregoing does not however concern documents referred to in sections DATE , DATE and DATE . If the contents of a document are such that the person who has drawn it up may not , according to LAW , section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) , ( CARDINAL ) or ( CARDINAL ) , of LAW , be heard as a witness in regard thereto , the document may not be presented in the judicial proceedings or in the course of the police investigation ; neither , unless warranted by special circumstances , may the document be presented in the judicial proceedings or in the course of the police investigation if a professional secret would thereby be disclosed . "
As from DATE , corresponding provisions are to be found in LAW , sections CARDINAL and DATE , of LAW .
CARDINAL . ORG The civil liability of the ORG is dealt with in LAW DATE ( skadeståndslagen CARDINAL:CARDINAL ) .
According to section CARDINAL , acts of public authorities may give rise to an entitlement to compensation in the event of fault or negligence .

However , under section CARDINAL , an action for damages will not lie in respect of decisions taken by ORG , the ORG , ORG , ORG or ORG . Furthermore , with regard to decisions of lower authorities , such as ORG , section CARDINAL of the LAW provides that such an action will not lie to the extent that the person concerned could have avoided losses by exhausting available remedies .
